page.title: 11SCHOOLS
page.content: There are first schools in both Sutton and Catfield. Sutton First is a modern building but Catfield is an old style village school built in 1853. When they are 8 the children transfer to the middle school at Stalham, which is about half a mile north of Sutton. Catfield children are taken to Stalham by coach. School starts at 8.30 a.m. because the coaches have to return to the villages to pick up the older children and take them to Stalham High. The large modern Middle School takes children from twelve surrounding villages within a four mile radius of Stalham. Because of the Middle School, children in this block have friends from other villages who can live a long way away. They often cycle to see them. When they are 12 years old the children go up the road to Stalham High School.
